critique: This document is an executive order from 1917 during World War I, delegating authority to the Secretary of the Navy regarding naval construction and procurement. It's difficult to assess its ideological tilt in modern terms, but given the context of wartime mobilization, a moderate expansion of executive power and federal control is expected. There's no direct impact on immigration or social inclusion. Economic regulation is increased due to the wartime needs. National security is prioritized over civil liberties in this context.
